    {"s":"beta-minus decay", "p":"produces", "o":"antineutrino", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"In beta-minus decay, a neutron inside the nucleus converts into a proton, releasing an electron — which we call a beta-minus particle — along with an antineutrino"},
    {"s":"beta-plus decay", "p":"produces", "o":"positron", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"In beta-plus decay, a proton in the nucleus converts into a neutron, releasing a positron"},
    {"s":"beta-plus decay", "p":"produces", "o":"neutrino", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"In beta-plus decay, a proton in the nucleus converts into a neutron, releasing a positron — which is a positively charged electron

evidence: In beta-plus decay, a proton in the nucleus converts into a neutron, releasing a positron
